Clean drinking water is not a partisan issue. #PFAS contamination affects hundreds of sites across the country, including Republican districts & Democratic districts. 

Our bipartisan PFAS Task Force is bringing Members together to more urgently address these harmful chemicals.

Finally, 4) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will work to pass more robust funding that prioritizes remediation and ensuring that Americans exposed to PFAS, including our country's veterans, get the health care and support they need.

3) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will meet with congressional leadership and committee chairs, on both sides of the aisle, to ensure PFAS clean-up is getting the adequate attention it deserves in this new Congress.

2) Our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force will continue to propose legislation to address PFAS contamination, including a national #PFAS environmental standard & urging the @DeptofDefense to more urgently clean-up hundreds of military sites with identified PFAS chemical contamination.

What will our bipartisan #PFAS Task Force do this Congress? Several key initiatives: 

1) We'll hold informational events for Members of Congress, Capitol Hill staff and communities impacted to increase awareness about PFAS chemicals. (cont.)

Each week, more #PFAS chemical contamination sites are being identified across the country. Hundreds of communities are already affected by this growing public health threat, including the towns of Oscoda & Flint in my district.

Our new Congressional #PFAS Task Force, founded by an equal number of Republicans and Democrats, will work to more urgently address the growing public health threat of dangerous PFAS chemicals. Simply put, we must do more to protect public health.
I‚Äôm announcing a new Congressional PFAS Task Force focused on more urgently addressing #PFAS contamination. Watch live:  https://bit.ly/2sHtgjP¬†
